info.title: NPR One API Reference
info.description:
NPR One is a smart application that brings the best of NPR and Member Station programming, newscasts, podcasts, and stories together to create a new experience for listening. It provides an editor-curated and localized mobile listening experience based on the content the listener chooses, likes, shares, and enjoys. The API provides all of the content and customization in a simple, structured way that is easy for application
developers to implement.

get.summary: Show a web-based login/signup form to a user
get.description:
If the parameters passed to this endpoint are correct, it will redirect to `npr.org/oauth2/login` for the user to complete the sign-in.

Currently acceptable values for `scope` are any combination of the following:
- `identity.readonly` - for read-only access to the Identity Service
- `identity.write` - for write access to the Identity Service
- `listening.readonly` - for read-only access to the Listening Service
- `listening.write` - for write access to the Listening Service
- `localactivation`

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: The client's ID

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: The client's URL to redirect to if the authentication is approved

parameters.name: response_type
parameters.description: The type of response; currently, only `code` is supported

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: A space-separated list of scope(s) requested by the application

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: A CSRF token generated by the client, to be roundtripped through the request for added security

post.summary: Initiate an OAuth2 login flow for limited input devices
post.description:
This flow should only be used by clients who cannot show a native webview or do not have advanced input controls. It is an alternative to `GET /authorization/v2/authorize`.

Third-party clients will need to use one or the other of these two endpoints, but they will generally not use both.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: The client's ID

parameters.name: client_secret
parameters.description: The client's secret key

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: A space-separated list of scope(s) requested by the application. Required for all untrusted clients; will be ignored for trusted clients.

post.summary: Create a new OAuth2 access token
post.description:
Please be aware that the required parameters are contingent on the `grant_type` that you select.

For the `authorization_code` grant type, you are **required** to pass in the `code` and `redirect_uri` parameters. `service`, `username` and `password` parameters will be ignored.

For the `client_credentials` grant type, you do not need to pass in any additional parameters beyond the basic requirements. `code`, `redirect_uri`, `service`, `username` and `password` parameters will be ignored.

For th

parameters.name: grant_type
parameters.description: The type of grant the client is requesting

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: The client's ID

parameters.name: client_secret
parameters.description: The client's secret key

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Required for `authorization_code` and `device_code` grant types. The authorization code from a successful call to `/authorization/v2/authorize`, or a device code from a successful call to `/authorization/v2/device`.

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: Required for `authorization_code` grant type. The requested redirect_uri.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Required for `password` grant type. The email address of an NPR user.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Required for `password` grant type. The password that matches the user specified with the username parameter.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: If logging in via a social service, this parameter should be set. Only used for the `password` grant type.

parameters.name: refresh_token
parameters.description: Required for `refresh_token` grant type. A valid refresh token from a previous successful call to `POST /authorization/v2/token`.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: A space-separated list of scope(s) requested by the application. Required for all untrusted clients; will be ignored for trusted clients.

parameters.name: token_type_hint
parameters.description: A hint about the type of the token submitted for a new access and refresh token. If unspecified, the default value is assumed to be `refresh_token`.

post.summary: Revoke an existing OAuth2 access token
post.description:
Our implementation follows the proposed IETF specification [RFC-7009](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7009).

If your client application offers the ability to for a logged-in user to log out, and you have access to a long-lived
`client_credentials` token (i.e. you have generated one that you are storing securely for the lifetime of the entire app
install), we suggest (but do not require) that you call this endpoint and revoke the access token belonging to the
logged-in user as part of your logout

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: A `client_credentials` access token from the same client application as the token being revoked. Should start with `Bearer`, followed by a space, followed by the token.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: The access token or refresh token that the client wants to have revoked.

parameters.name: token_type_hint
parameters.description: A hint about the type of the token submitted for a new access and refresh token. If unspecified, the default value is assumed to be `refresh_token`.

post.summary: Update the following status of the logged-in user for a particular aggregation
post.description: After a successful call, this returns a User document with an updated list of affiliations.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A JSON-serialized object which contains data about a user affiliation such as the aggregation ID, affiliation rating, aggregation URL, days since last listen, and following status.

put.summary: Update the logged-in user's favorite station(s)
put.description: Right now, only the primary station can be changed. Previously selected stations will not be deleted, but the new station will be moved to first in the array.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A JSON-serialized object which contains data about a user affiliation such as the aggregation ID, affiliation rating, aggregation URL, days since last listen, and following status.

get.summary: Get the latest state information about the logged-in user
get.description: After a successful login, the client should send a `GET` call approximately once an hour to refresh the user data.

post.summary: Copy listening data from a temporary user account to the logged-in user's account
post.description:
This can and should only be used by clients who have access to the `temporary_user` grant type.
    Third-party developers do not have access to this grant type by default, and will not need this endpoint.

parameters.name: temp_user
parameters.description: The temporary user's ID before the user registered or logged in

get.summary: Get a set of recommendations for an aggregation
get.description: This endpoint provides a list of recent audio items associated with the aggregation along with metadata about the aggregation.

parameters.name: aggId
parameters.description: ID of an aggregation such as a program or podcast

parameters.name: startNum
parameters.description: The result to start with. Allows paging through the episodes of a podcast or program, with the default, `startNum=0`, being the most recent episode

get.summary: Get the list of available channels
get.description: These channels allow the user to specify a focus for the content returned in the recommendations endpoint.

parameters.name: exploreOnly
parameters.description: If set to `true`, this call will return only channels that should be shown in the client's `Explore` view

get.summary: Get recent ratings the logged-in user has submitted
get.description: This endpoint provides the list of recently-rated audio recommendations that the logged-in user has consumed. Some rated recommendations are filtered, such as sponsorship and donation.

get.summary: Get a list of recommendations from a category of content from an organization
get.description: This endpoint provides a list of recommendations from a category of content from  an organization.

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: ID of an organization, such as an NPR One station

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: One of the three categories of content - newscast, story, or podcast

get.summary: Get a variety of details about an organization including various lists of recent audio items
get.description: This endpoint provides a variety of details about an organization including various lists of recent audio items.

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: ID of an organization, such as an NPR One station

get.summary: Retrieve the most recent promo audio heard by the logged-in user
get.description: Gets the most recently played promo for which the user has neither tapped through the promo or listened to the target story.

post.summary: Collect new ratings for media previously recommended to the logged-in user
post.description:
This endpoint is the main mechanism for providing feedback from the user to NPR about the recommendations that are obtained from `GET /listening/v2/recommendations`.

A fully-populated link to this endpoint is returned with each individual recommendation and is located in the AudioItemDocument under the `links['recommendations']` object. The query parameters in this link should not be modified.
Be sure to copy and send back the entire ratings object (RatingData), as new fields may be added to it

parameters.name: recommend
parameters.description: If set to `false`, this call will return a blank document; otherwise it will return a new recommendation object

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A JSON-serialized object which contains data about a user affiliation such as the aggregation ID, affiliation rating, aggregation URL, days since last listen, and following status.

get.summary: Get a list of media for the logged-in user from NPR's recommendation engine
get.description:
This endpoint returns a list of audio recommendations. It is designed to be used for an initial list of recommendations, and then `GET /listening/v2/ratings?recommend=true` should be used for subsequent requests for recommendations.

A fully-populated link to the ratings endpoint is returned with each individual recommendation and is located in the AudioItemDocument under the `links['recommendations']` object. The query parameters in this link should not be modified.
Be sure to copy and send bac

parameters.name: sharedMediaId
parameters.description: This media was shared directly with the user; if provided, the service will add this recommendation to the top of the list

parameters.name: notifiedMediaId
parameters.description: The user received a push notification about this media; if provided, the service will add this recommendation to the top of the list

get.summary: Get a list of recent audio and aggregation items associated with search terms
get.description: In the schema shown below, SearchItemDocument is not an actual type of returned object; the object returned by a search will be either an AggregationAudioItemListDocument or an AudioItemDocument.

parameters.name: searchTerms
parameters.description: Search terms to search on; can include URL-encoded punctuation

get.summary: Send a donation email to the logged-in user (only on request)
get.description: This will send a station-specific donation email to the logged-in user.

**Not** for use by NPR One clients (for whom sponsorship is already integrated into the Listening Service), this endpoint is designed to be used by our other client applications to request sponsorship on behalf of a user. Sponsorship units are returned in the form of DAAST XML. It is worth noting that this endpoint attempts to always return XML, even in the case of exceptions.

The default behavior of this endpoint is asynchronous; on an initial request, a call to our external sponsorship provid

parameters.name: forceResult
parameters.description: Whether to force a synchronous call to our external sponsorship provider; the default behavior is asynchronous.

parameters.name: adCount
parameters.description: How many sponsorship units to request in one call; if left unspecified, the default behavior is to return only 1.

post.summary: Record tracking data for DAAST sponsorship units
post.description:
**Not** for use by NPR One clients (for whom sponsorship is already integrated into the Listening Service), this endpoint is designed to be used by our other client applications to submit tracking information for sponsorship units obtained from the `GET /sponsorship/v2/ads` endpoint.

The tracking information should be submitted in the body of the request in the form of a JSON object following the Collection.Doc+JSON specification.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: A JSON-serialized object which contains data about a user affiliation such as the aggregation ID, affiliation rating, aggregation URL, days since last listen, and following status.

get.summary: List stations close to you or filter by search criteria
get.description:
This endpoint has two main use cases:

- If no query parameters passed in, it returns a list of stations that are geographically closest to the calling client (based on GeoIP information)
- If one or more query parameters are passed in, it performs a search of NPR stations that match those search criteria (not taking into account the client's physical location)

Clients wanting to implement a 'Change Station' UI should use this endpoint to power their search. In most cases, you'll want to build

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search terms to search on; can be a station name, network name, call letters, or zipcode

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: A city to look for stations from; intended to be paired with `state`

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: A CSRF token generated by the client, to be roundtripped through the request for added security

parameters.name: lat
parameters.description: A latitude value from a geographic coordinate system; only works if paired with `lon`

parameters.name: lon
parameters.description: A longitude value from a geographic coordinate system; only works if paired with `lat`

get.summary: Retrieve metadata for the station with the given numeric ID
get.description:
This endpoint retrieves information about a given station, based on its numeric ID, which is consistent across all of NPR's APIs.

A typical use case for this data is for clients who want to create a dropdown menu, modal/pop-up or dedicated page displaying more information about the station the client is localized to, including, for example, links to the station's homepage and donation (pledge) page.

parameters.name: stationId
parameters.description: The numeric ID of a station
